title: Les Dyl
text:
Leslie "Les" P. Dyl (born 1 December 1952) is an English former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1970s and 1980s. He played at representative level for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> and <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a>, and at club level for <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> and <a href="Bramley%20RLFC">Bramley</a>, as a or , i.e. number 2 or 5, or, 3 or 4.
Playing career.
International honours.
Les Dyl won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> while at Leeds in 1975 against France, in the <a href="1975%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">1975 Rugby League World Cup</a> against Wales, France, Wales, New Zealand, New Zealand (sub), Australia, and Australia, in 1975 against <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Papua New Guinea</a> (non-test), in 1977 Wales, and France, in 1978 France, and Wales, in 1981 against Wales, and won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> while at Leeds in 1974 against Australia (2 matches), and New Zealand (3 matches), in the <a href="1977%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">1977 Rugby League World Cup</a> against France, New Zealand, and Australia (2 matches) including the <a href="1977%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup%20Final">World Cup Final</a> at the <a href="Sydney%20Cricket%20Ground">Sydney Cricket Ground</a>, in 1978 against Australia, and in 1982 against Australia.
In addition to the above <a href="Test%20match%20%28rugby%20league%29">Test match</a>es, Les Dyl played as an <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a> in <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a>'s 7-8 defeat by <a href="France%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">France</a> in the <a href="Exhibition%20game">friendly</a> at <a href="Stadio%20Pier%20Luigi%20Penzo">Stadio Pier Luigi Penzo</a>, <a href="Venice">Venice</a> on Saturday 31 July 1982.
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
Les Dyl played as an <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a>, i.e. number 14, (replacing <a href="Ronnie%20Cowan%20%28rugby%29">Ronnie Cowan</a>) in <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>' 7-24 defeat by <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh</a> in the <a href="1971%20Challenge%20Cup">1971</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1970%E2%80%9371%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1970–71 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 15 May 1971, in front of a crowd of 85,514, played left-, i.e. number 4, in the 13-16 defeat by <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> in the <a href="1972%20Challenge%20Cup">1972</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1971%E2%80%9372%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1971–72 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 13 May 1972, in front of a crowd of 89,495, played left-, and scored a <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a> in the 16-7 victory over <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes</a> in the <a href="1977%20Challenge%20Cup">1977</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1976%E2%80%9377%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1976–77 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 7 May 1977, in front of a crowd of 80,871, and played left- in the 14-12 victory over <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> in the <a href="1978%20Challenge%20Cup">1978</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1977%E2%80%9378%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1977–78 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 13 May 1978, in front of a crowd of 96,000.
County Cup Final appearances.
Les Dyl played left-, i.e. number 4, in <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>' 36-9 victory over <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury</a> in the <a href="1972%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1972</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1972%E2%80%9373%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1972–73 season</a> at <a href="Odsal%20Stadium">Odsal Stadium</a>, <a href="Bradford">Bradford</a> on Saturday 7 October 1972, played left-, and scored 2-<a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">tries</a> in the 7-2 victory over <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> in the <a href="1973%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1973</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1973%E2%80%9374%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1973–74 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 20 October 1973, played left-, and scored a <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a>, in the 15-11 victory over <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> in the <a href="1975%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1975</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1975%E2%80%9376%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1975–76 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 15 November 1975, played left-, scored a 2-<a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">tries</a>, and was <a href="player%20of%20the%20match">man of the match</a> winning the <a href="White%20Rose%20Trophy">White Rose Trophy</a> in the 16-12 victory over <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> in the <a href="1976%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1976</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1976%E2%80%9377%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1976–77 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 16 October 1976, and played left-, i.e. number 4, in the 15-6 victory over <a href="Halifax%20R.L.F.C.">Halifax</a> in the <a href="1979%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1979</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1979%E2%80%9380%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1979–80 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 27 October 1979.
Player's No.6/John Player Trophy Final appearances.
Les Dyl played left-, i.e. number 4, in <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>' 12-7 victory over <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a> in the <a href="1972%E2%80%9373%20League%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">1972–73</a> <a href="League%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">Player's No.6 Trophy</a> Final during the <a href="1972%E2%80%9373%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1972–73 season</a> at <a href="Fartown%20Ground">Fartown Ground</a>, <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a> on Saturday 24 March 1973, and played left- in the 4-15 defeat by <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> in the <a href="1982%E2%80%9383%20League%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">1982–83</a> <a href="League%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">John Player Trophy</a> Final during the <a href="1982%E2%80%9383%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1982–83 season</a> at <a href="Elland%20Road">Elland Road</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 22 January 1983.
Testimonial match.
Les Dyl's <a href="Testimonial%20match">Testimonial match</a> at <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> took place in 1980.
Outside of rugby league.
Les now runs a hotel, bar & restaurant named 'Rags' in <a href="Bridlington">Bridlington</a>, where he and his wife Julie live.
